ranked_diseases.explanation: Most likely diagnosis given that all three reference cases with identical presentation (atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor) were diagnosed with this syndrome. This syndrome is caused by SMARCB1 mutations and typically presents with AT/RT in early childhood.
Alternative rhabdoid tumor predisposition syndrome caused by SMARCA4 mutations. Also presents with AT/RT in childhood but is less common than type 1.
Cancer predisposition syndrome that can rarely present with brain tumors including AT/RT in childhood, though other tumor types are more common.
Can present with various childhood brain tumors including rarely AT/RT, though more commonly presents with gliomas and other tumor types.
Primarily associated with medulloblastoma but can rarely present with other CNS tumors. Less likely given specific AT/RT presentation.
